text: Tilly van der Zwaard (18 January 1938 â€“ 6 February 2019) was a Dutch middle distance runner. She was born in Leiden, the Netherlands. She participated in the 1962 European Athletics Championships in Belgrade where she won a bronze medal in the 400 m event. Van der Zwaard twice represented her native country in the 400 m event at the Summer Olympics, in 1964 and 1968.Tilly van der Made-van der Zwaard . sports-reference.com Her best achievement was sixth place in 1964. Van der Zwaard died in Edgewater, Florida on 6 February 2019 from complications of Alzheimer's disease, aged 81. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Dutch athletes Category:Middle-distance runners Category:Olympians for the Netherlands Category:Sportspeople from Leiden
title: Tilly van der Zwaard
